boat.full_description: Reputed to have won the Isle of Man race in her early years, Snowdrop was purchased from Fleetwood in the 1960s and taken to the East Coast via  the canal system to be restored at West Stockwith on the river Trent.  Thereafter in the spring she would be sailed around down the Trent out into the Humber and around the coast to Bridlington where she stayed until  the Autumn before making the return trip. She was sold out of OGA ownership in the early  70. Information about her subsequent history would be appreciated.
boat.name: Snowdrop
